name: Charith Senanayake
bio: Charith Panduka Senanayake (born December 19, 1962, in Colombo) is a former Sri Lankan cricketer and businessman. He has played in 3 Tests and 7 ODIs from 1990 to 1991.[1] He also served as manager of Sri Lanka national cricket team for a considerable period of time. He also played professional cricket in Kenya representing Mombasa Sports Club. He has also worked as an expertise in marketing in several positions including marketing manager of Macwoods Ltd in Sri Lanka, marketing consultant of Tea Tang Ltd in Sri Lanka, general manager of LAB International Ltd in Kenya and CEO of Afri Bridge Trade Exporters in Kenya.[2]
